column4: I am trying to put linux on my fat32 USB key and am having trouble with dpkg. I want it to not create symlinks, but rather make a second copy of the file (instead of linking), like copy does when you do -L or --deference. Is there a way to do this with dpkg/apt?
you can't run linux natively on fat32,   no permissions.   use an extfs
I don't care about permissions. I CAN do it, I just have to work arround the symlinking. I want FULL access to my os from ANY computer (I do a lot of recovery work).
